title: Emre Can could be reinvented as central defender under Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri
text:
Emre Can is set to be used as a centre-back by Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri after impressing in the position for Germany.

Normally a midfielder, Can was deployed in defence in Germany's 2-2 draw with Argentina on Tuesday night, a position he has already played in at Juventus under Sarri's predecessor Massimiliano Allegri.

Allegri has always supported the theory of a role change for Can from midfielder to an aggressive and fast central defender.

Emre Can's performance for Germany has convinced Maurizio Sarri to use him as a defender

Can impressed at centre-back in Germany's 2-2 draw against Argentina on Wednesday night

Juventus boss Sarri may now call upon Can more often after deciding to play him in defence

Allegri used Can as a third central defender when Juventus beat Atletico Madrid 3-0 in the last-16 of the Champions League last season and was rewarded for his decision as the German produced an excellent display.

Can has endured a difficult start to life under Sarri; he was left out of the club's Champions League squad for the group stages and has only played 78 minutes in Serie A so far this season.

This week, Can admitted his frustration with his situation, saying: 'I'm not happy (at Juventus) right now.'

Can has expressed his frustration at having been used sparingly by Juventus so far this season

However, the 25-year-old expressed hope that his situation will soon improve.

He said: 'I'm not playing much at the moment. I played a lot last season, especially in important matches, for Juventus, and I also played well.

'I haven't had a chance this season but now I think that, when I return to the club, I'll have a shot at playing again.

'I'm definitely grateful to Joachim Low because I hadn't played much and he still called me up.

'That's why I was simply happy to have played again.'

Daniele Rugani could depart Juventus in January, which would be of great benefit to Can

Sarri plans to copy Allegri's idea and bring Can back into defence, which is likely to lead to him being included in Juventus' updated Champions League squad in February, if, as expected, they make it through to the knockout stages.

EMRE CAN'S JUVENTUS RECORD 2019-20: Serie A - Three appearances 2018-19: Serie A - 29 appearances, four goals, one assist Champions League - Six appearances Coppa Italia - One appearance Supercoppa Italiana - One appearance

Another factor that could work in Can's favour is the fact that defender Daniele Rugani, who hasn't played at all this season, is tired of sitting on the bench and may ask to leave in January.

If Rugani does depart midway through the campaign then it is likely that Can will replace him. Several Premier League clubs expressed interest in signing Rugani in the summer, but he turned down a move to Wolves.

Arsenal were also linked but did not have enough money to buy Rugani, instead electing to sign David Luiz from Chelsea.

With Merih Demiral as the first choice alternative to Matthijs de Ligt and Leonardo Bonucci, it is understandable that Rugani is frustrated and it seems certain that he will leave Juventus either in January or next summer.

Juventus are determined not to sell Can unless they receive an offer that is too good to refuse. Sarri wants to convince the player to take advantage of the opportunities in the club without asking to be transferred.

An impressive display in defence for Germany has certainly convinced Fabio Paratici, Juventus' sporting director, that Can's departure is no longer inevitable.
